title: Double Vision and New Onset Strabismus in an Adult
author: Eulee Seow
keyPoints: Check what the patient means by double vision – is it monocular or binocular?
Organise urgent imaging in pupil involving third nerve palsies or sixth nerve palsies with papilloedema
Warn patients with sudden onset double vision not to drive

q1.text: Is the double vision monocular or binocular?

q2.text: What is the onset of the double vision?

answers.text: Dilated pupil with third nerve palsy

q4.text: Any signs of raised intracranial pressure (papilloedema, headache)?

q5.text: Any symptoms suggestive of Giant Cell Arteritis (jaw claudication, temporal headache, scalp tenderness)?

q6.text: Which cranial nerve palsy pattern is present?

q7.text: Any associated systemic symptoms (fatigue, muscle weakness, ptosis variation)?

monocular.text: Monocular diplopia: Examine for refractive errors, cataracts, corneal irregularities, or retinal pathology. Refer to ophthalmology for detailed examination.

urgent1.text: URGENT: Pupil-involving third nerve palsy. Immediate CT/MRI brain and urgent neurology referral to rule out posterior communicating artery aneurysm.

urgent2.text: URGENT: Possible raised intracranial pressure. Immediate CT brain and urgent neurology referral. Consider space-occupying lesion.

gca_urgent.text: URGENT: Possible Giant Cell Arteritis. Immediate ESR, CRP, and temporal artery biopsy. Start high-dose steroids if high suspicion. Urgent rheumatology referral.

diabetes_workup.text: Pupil-sparing third nerve palsy: Check blood glucose, HbA1c, and blood pressure. Often microvascular cause. Monitor for recovery over 3-6 months.

trauma_history.text: Fourth nerve palsy: Often related to head trauma. If no trauma history, consider imaging. May improve with time or require prism glasses.

sixth_nerve_workup.text: Sixth nerve palsy: Check for diabetes, hypertension. If isolated and no red flags, monitor for improvement. Consider MRI if no improvement in 3 months.

myasthenia_workup.text: Possible myasthenia gravis: Arrange acetylcholine receptor antibodies, Tensilon test, and neurology referral for further assessment.

thyroid_workup.text: Consider thyroid eye disease: Check thyroid function tests, consider orbital imaging if proptosis present. Ophthalmology referral.
